title: Abuse Assessment Screen (AAS)
description: Detects domestic abuse (intimate partner violence) in pregnant and non-pregnant women in healthcare settings

parameters.name: emotional_physical_abuse
parameters.description: Have you ever been emotionally or physically abused by your partner or someone important to you?

parameters.name: physical_hurt_recently
parameters.description: Since your last visit, have you been hit, slapped, kicked, or physically hurt by anyone?

parameters.name: physical_hurt_pregnancy
parameters.description: Since you became pregnant, have you been hit, slapped, kicked, or physically hurt by anyone?

parameters.name: sexual_abuse
parameters.description: In the last year, has anyone forced you to do something sexual you didn't want to do?

parameters.name: afraid_of_partner
parameters.description: Are you afraid of your partner or someone close to you?

ranges.interpretation: Negative result for domestic violence. Continue to offer support and information about available resources. Re-evaluate in future consultations.
Positive result for domestic violence. Requires more detailed assessment, offering support, and referral to specialized resources. Document appropriately and follow institutional protocols.

references: McFarlane J, Parker B, Soeken K, Bullock L. Assessing for abuse during pregnancy. Severity and frequency of injuries and associated entry into prenatal care. JAMA. 1992;267(23):3176-8.
Norton LB, Peipert JF, Zierler S, Lima B, Hume L. Battering in pregnancy: an assessment of two screening methods. Obstet Gynecol. 1995;85(3):321-5.
formula: Any 'yes' answer results in positive screening
notes: Apply at first prenatal visit, at least once per trimester, and postpartum
Must be applied in a private setting, without the partner present
Requires institutional protocol for positive cases
Can be used in pregnant and non-pregnant women
